pr_title: Remove deprecated usage of testCompile configuration

timeline.message:
Replace testCompile usage by testImplementation

- fix taskArtifact declaration
- make testImplementation non transitive by default (as we did for testCompile

timeline.author: mark-vieira

timeline.bodyText: We can probably remove this now since we fail if you add any dependencies to this configuration.
timeline.author: mark-vieira

timeline.bodyText: I assume this is to deal with standalone test projects, that don't have a "main" sourceset. If so, should we be using testRuntimeClasspath here? I dunno, @rjernst, what do you think? Should we even be auditing third party libraries for qa projects? I think we were discussion what all precommit checks should apply to those recently.
timeline.author: mark-vieira

replies.bodyText: I don't think we need third part audit for any tests, just our production code.
replies.author: rjernst

replies.bodyText: Ok, let's leave this as-is for now, and we can rip this out when we refactor the standalone test plugin.
replies.author: mark-vieira

timeline.bodyText: If we just used testRuntimeClasspath wouldn't that work as well?
timeline.author: mark-vieira

replies.bodyText: That was my initial thought too. but that drags in runtimeOnly which is too much and causes.
replies.author: breskeby

replies.bodyText: we probably do not need / want testRuntime at all.
replies.author: breskeby
